fields.headline: This week's new events
fields.bodyText: Bog Snorkelling, Llanwrtyd Wells What started in 1986 as a simple celebration of the joys of swimming two lengths of a boggy trench in mid-Wales has now developed into a fully fledged sporting weekend, albeit one where all of the sports are based around that same bog. Over the weekend you can take part yourself and try to beat the bog snorkelling world record or simply enjoy the bog snorkelling triathlon, which combines running, cycling and, yes, bog snorkelling. Other events include mountain bike bog snorkelling, which involves a lead-filled bicycle. Those who don't like bogs can take part in the wife-carrying contest, which is also happening in Llanwrtyd Wells. Various venues, Sat to Mon, green-events.co.uk Iain Aitch Gingerline HQ, London Not since a large-bosomed lady was stashed within a knackwurst ('Allo 'Allo, 1984) has so much subterfuge surrounded food. Would-be diners at Gingerline's flamboyant feasts are texted the location just an hour before the start, then sworn to secrecy for the event's entire run. So we've no idea what's in store this time, except that it will involve delicacies, debauchery and will require guests to remain as tight-lipped as a French resistance cell. Secret location in east London, Wed to 5 Oct, gingerline.co.uk Colette Bernhardt Notting Hill Carnival, London Often summer's last hurrah in the capital, William Hague's favourite street festival is soaked in history, from the solidarity of a community under attack to the annual photo of a policeman dancing with a Jamaican auntie. Celebration is the real story here, though, and it is worth dipping into just to marvel at the sheer effort that goes into the dancers' outfits. Music is, of course, central to the event, as sound systems battle to produce the best and the loudest sounds. Seek out the Tighten Up crew on the Gladdy Wax sound system for some old-school Notting Hill sounds. Various venues, W11, Sun, Mon, thenottinghillcarnival.com IA Out & about Forest Of Galtres Festival, York, Saturday, Sunday Jousting, real ales and a Dragon Ball are all part of the fun at this medieval themed festival. Mosswood Grange Farm Football In The River, Bourton-on-the-Water, Monday Bringing new meaning to the phrase 'liquid football', the Cotswolds plays host to the world's wettest kickabout. River Windrush Gravy Wrestling, Stacksteads, Monday Prepare to watch humans act like Yorkshire puddings and possibly see 2009 champion Stone Cold Steve Bisto in action. Rose 'N' Bowl Blackpool Illuminations, Friday The annual light show is back in town and will run to 4 Nov. Promenade Dundee Flower and Food Festival, Friday to 2 Sep Sample the finest food and horticulture as Dundee puts on its annual food and flower extravaganza. Camperdown Country Park
